parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control - Map

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Draws an icon on the map. This command needs to be called every frame, preferably using the [[User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onDraw|onDraw]] UI Event Handler.

</value></part><part><name>pr </name>=<value> Since command has to be drawn on each frame, performance can be decreased!

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> map [[drawIcon]] [texture, color, position, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, align]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> map: [[Control]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> texture: [[String]] - Icon texture
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> color: [[Array]] - Text and icon color in format [r,g,b,a]
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> position: [[Position2D]], [[Position3D]] or [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> width: [[Number]] - Width of the icon (but not the text)
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> height: [[Number]] - Height of the icon (but not the text)
</value></part><part><name>p7</name>=<value> angle: [[Number]] - Rotation angle of the icon (but not the text)
</value></part><part><name>p8</name>=<value> text (Optional): [[String]]
</value></part><part><name>p9</name>=<value> shadow (Optional): [[Number]] or [[Boolean]] - 0 ([[false]]): no shadow, 1: shadow (for text), 2 ([[true]]): outline (works for text and for icon only if icon angle is 0)
</value></part><part><name>p10</name>=<value> textSize (Optional): [[Number]] - Size of the text in UI units (since Arma 3 v0.72)
</value></part><part><name>p11</name>=<value> font (Optional): [[String]] - (since Arma 3 v0.72)
</value></part><part><name>p12</name>=<value> align (Optional, default: "right"): [[String]] - "left", "right" or "center" (since Arma 3 v0.72)

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> Red icon with text: <code>[[findDisplay]] 12 [[displayCtrl]] 51 [[ctrlAddEventHandler]] ["Draw", {
	_this [[select]] 0 [[drawIcon]] [
		"iconStaticMG", <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Custom images can also be used: [[getMissionPath]] "\myFolder\myIcon.paa"</value></part></template>
		[1,0,0,1],
		[[getPos]] [[player]],
		24,
		24,
		[[getDir]] [[player]],
		"Player Vehicle",
		1,
		0.03,
		"TahomaB",
		"right"
	]
}];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Green text only: <code>[[findDisplay]] 12 [[displayCtrl]] 51 [[ctrlAddEventHandler]] ["Draw", {
	_this [[select]] 0 [[drawIcon]] [
		"#(rgb,1,1,1)color(1,1,1,1)",
		[0,1,0,1],
		[[player]],
		0,
		0,
		0,
		[[name]] [[player]]
	]
}];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[drawArrow]] [[drawEllipse]] [[drawLine]] [[drawRectangle]] [[drawPolygon]] [[drawTriangle]]
</value></part></template>

<dd class="note">icon will always remain the same width and height, if you want an icon scaled to the map, use:<code>('''sizeInMeters''' * 0.15) * 10^(abs log (ctrlMapScale _ctrl))</code> for width and height (guessimated).

<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 20, 2014 - 16:59 (UTC)</dd>

<dd class="note">
If you want only text with no icon, you can use "#(argb,8,8,3)color(0,0,0,0)" as texture.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 4, 2016 - 05:41 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Benargee|Benargee]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Arma 3 1.54<br>
This command doesn't seem to play nice with [[onEachFrame]]. It seems to draw on the main screen while maintaing position relative to the map position<br>
Example:
<code>[[onEachFrame]] {
 	 [[findDisplay]] 12 [[displayCtrl]] 51 [[drawIcon]] ['iconStaticMG',[1,0,0,1],[[getPos]] [[player]],24,24,[[getDir]] [[player]],'Player Vehicle',1,0.03,'TahomaB','right'];
};</code>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 13, 2016 - 21:12 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Icaruk|Icaruk]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
If you unPBO the following addon:<br>
<code>@ui_f_data.pbo<br></code>
You can find the possible icons inside this folder:<br>
<code>ui_f\data\map\vehicleicons</code><br>
For example:<br>
If you want to use "iconman_ca.paa"  you will write "iconman" on the texture string.
</dd>
</dl>
